case.chief_complaint: You came to the hospital because you were experiencing a heaviness in your chest. You are nervous about your symptoms because your father died suddenly of a heart attack when he was 50.
free_information: The heaviness came on gradually, you were seated at desk at home when symptoms appeared
It was pretty severe when it first started, gradually improved and is now gone
It started around 2 hours ago, got better on the way here and stopped 20-30 minutes ago
You were feeling slightly nauseated and sweaty prior to arriving, but you feel better now.
You have been fully boosted for COVID, but do not always get a flu vaccine.
You had a hernia in your groin that was repaired when you were 26.
You do not have any allergies that you are aware of.
Your father died suddenly of a heart attack when he was 50 years old.
Your mother passed away from breast cancer two years ago.
You have had difficulty maintaining an erection for the past 2 years and have considered speaking to your doctor about this.
You do get pain in your left leg when you walk, a cramp in the calf. It goes away when you stop walking.
locked_information: The heaviness feels like a weight on the chest
The location is center of your chest
The pattern of symptom was constant when it occurred

You have never had chest pain or pressure like you are experiencing now, but have experienced a milder chest discomfort when walking (thought this was heart burn or you had a stomach problem). Discomfort would happen when walking up long hill near end of route, where you would take an antacid and feel better.
You also felt an aching pain in your jaw and both shoulders when the pressure was at its worst
you have not noticed anything that makes the heaviness worse
you took two or three tums but had no relief
You have been stressed about your finances recently.
You've had high blood pressure since you were 50. You take a water pill for that and were recently started on another new medication.
You've had high cholesterol for many years and take a statin for this.

On your most recent visit to your doctor, she said you have pre-diabetes - you are not sure what this means, but she recommended you lose weight. To lose weight, you started a walking program; this was about 6 months ago.
Read this list from your phone if asked for specific medications: "Hydrochlorothiazide, Amlodipine, Atorvastatin".
You are a former smoker. You started smoking when you were in college at 19 years old and quit about 5 years ago. You smoked about one pack per day.
You drink about 2 glasses of wine or a cocktail during the week, more on the weekend.
